intro: Andreettaea oblonga, commonly known as the Brazilian broom. It is a flowering plant native to Brazil, belonging to the Fabaceae family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Andreettaea oblonga is often found in open areas and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
